Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched a gem for the Mets on Saturday.
Francisco Alvarez came through for a second time on the day with a perfectly placed drive into left-center for a two-run double.
Edwin Diaz shut down the Phillies in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza said the atmosphere was 'unbelievable.'
The Mets are playing like a playoff team.
The Mets called up Luisangel Acuna, who launched his third homer in just his eighth big league game.
Post-Match Reflections: Mendoza's group will enter its most significant showdown of the season having at worst split a series with the division-best Phillies.
Manaea was excellent again in seven-plus innings.
Alonso might be playing his final home game as a Met.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' offense was loud enough with a three-run seventh inning making the difference in a 6-3 win over the Phillies.
The game had the weight and feeling of October despite being technically played on Sept. 21.
